sub_title: PhD candidate in materials chemistry and condensed matter physics
summary:
I am a curious person interested in how things work. My interest in functional materials, and the relationship between structure and properties. Doing research into materials that have the potential to end up in products and devices that improve our everyday lives is highly appealing to me and has landed me somewhere in between the fields of chemistry and physics. 

I am an eager worker that dives deep into what I am working on. My interest in communication about my work also makes me an enthusiastic presenter.

I believe myself to be an open-minded person with a broad perspective. In addition, through having varied interests outside natural sciences, e.g., touching on creative arts (drawing, painting, graphic design, and photography), I consider myself to have a broad and diverse skill set, and someone that is always willing to learn.

projects.title: MSc thesis: Local investigation of the metal-to-insulator transition in SmNiO3 thin films.
projects.description: MSc thesis, supervised by prof. dr. B. (Beatriz) Noheda of the Nanostructures of Functional Oxide group of the Zernike Institute for Advanced Materials, and CogniGron Institute, of the University of Groningen. The project involved the pulsed laser deposition of SmNiO3 films, and the characterization of said films using conductive atomic force microscopy, X-ray diffraction and electrical probing techniques.

contributors.headline: PhD candidate in materials chemistry and condensed matter physics

projects.title: Masters research project: Robust photoactuating artificial muscles from amphiphilic molecular motors
projects.description: Research project supervised by prof. dr. B. L. (Ben) Feringa of the Synthetic Organic Chemistry group (Feringalab) of the Stratingh Institute for Chemistry, of the University of Groningen. The project involved the organic synthesis of amino-acid-modified, amphiphilic, light-driven, second-generation, artificial molecular motors, and the characterization of these motors and their self-assemblies using proton- and carbon-NMR, UV-vis absorption spectroscopy, cryogenic electron microscopy, and photoactuating experiments. This research was presented at the annual Nanosymposium of the University of Groningen on 25-06-2022.

contributors.headline: PhD candidate in materials chemistry and condensed matter physics

projects.title: BSc thesis: Chemical solution deposition of doped-zirconia films.
projects.description: BSc thesis, supervised by prof. dr. B. (Beatriz) Noheda of the Nanostructures of Functional Oxide group of the Zernike Institute for Advanced Materials, of the University of Groningen. The project involved the synthesis of (doped-)zirconia films on silicon by metalloorganic decomposition of spin-coated low-toxicity chemical solutions, and the analysis of said films using grazing incidence X-ray diffraction, and atomic force microscopy.

contributors.headline: PhD candidate in materials chemistry and condensed matter physics

projects.title: Extracurricular research: Synthesis of AgBiS2 nanocrystals from a low-toxicity sulfur precursor.
projects.description: Research in collaboration with QDI systems, supervised by dr. L. (Loredana) Protesescu of the Nanomaterials Chemistry group of the Zernike Institute for Advanced Materials of the University of Groningen, and dr. A. (Artem) Shulga, CEO of QDI systems. The project involved the hot-injection synthesis of AgBiS2 quantum dots from a low-toxicity thiourea precursor, and the characterization of said quantum dots using UV-vis absorption, X-ray diffraction, and transmission electron microscopy. The project was awarded 10 ECTS, which were added as extracurricular credits to my BSc in Chemistry.

contributors.headline: PhD candidate in materials chemistry and condensed matter physics

profile_positions.description:
PhD candidate in materials chemistry and solid state physics, in the condensed matter and interfaces group of the Debye Institute for Nanomaterials Science of Utrecht University.

My PhD project is affiliated with the QuMat research initiative.
profile_positions.title: PHD Candidate

profile_positions.description: I was a student member of the Programme Committee of the Top Master Programme in Nanoscience. The programme committee is a consultative body at the degree programme level, that gives advice on how to guarantee and improve the quality of the degree programme. It has an advisory role with regard to the curriculum and education of the Top Master. The committee is made up of both student and staff members. As a student member, I represent students involved in the degree programme.
profile_positions.title: Student Member Programme Committee MSc Nanoscience

profile_positions.description: I was teaching assistant for the course ‘Physcial Properties of Materials 1’, taught in the second year of the BSc in Chemistry. The course is coordinated by dr. G. R. (Graeme) Blake of the Nanostructures of Functional Oxides group of the Zernike Institute for Advanced Materials.
profile_positions.title: Teaching Assistant

profile_positions.description: I was a tutor at Bijles Bèta, where I supported and tutor high school students of all years in the subjects of Chemistry, Physics, and Mathematics at VWO, HAVO and VMBO levels.
profile_positions.title: Bijlesdocent wiskunde/natuurwetenschap

volunteer_experiences.description: I was the chairman of a committee of de Chemische Binding that organises activities of a social nature for its members. As chairman I was responsible for the functioning of the committee and the execution of our activities. I also chaired the meetings the committee.

I was the secretary of a committee of de Chemische Binding that organises activities of a social nature for its members. As secretary I was responsible for taking minutes during meetings, contact with third parties and overall planning.
I was a member of a committee whose aim it is to organise activities for first year students of the Bachelor's degrees in Chemistry and Chemical Engineering at the University of Groningen.
